questions.question: I watched several movies .......................... the summer vacation.
questions.description: During is a preposition. It is followed by a noun. While is a conjunction. It is followed by a clause.

questions.question: I met Harry ........................ my stay in Germany.
My grandfather was in hospital ......................... the winter.
questions.description: During is used to say when something happens.

questions.question: I will phone you .......................... the meeting.
I learned German .......................... I was working in Germany.
questions.description: While is a conjunction. It is followed by a clause.

questions.question: It happened ........................ I was away.
questions.description: While is a conjunction. It is used to connect two clauses.

questions.question: The shop is closed .......................... the whole of June.
questions.description: We prefer during to talk about the whole of the period.

questions.question: I met Alice ......................... I was working in Seoul.
questions.description: We use while to connect two clauses.

questions.question: It happened .......................... the summer.
questions.description: We use during before a noun that acts as its object.

questions.question: I fell asleep ....................... I was watching the film.
questions.description: Here 'while' connects the two clauses I fell asleep and I was watching the film.

questions.question: I met some wonderful people ...................... my stay in France.
